title: Static friction - block pushed against a wall

content.question: A block of mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> is held at rest against a vertical wall by an applied force <math alttext="F sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub></math>. The wall exerts a normal force <math alttext="F sub N" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></msub></math> on the block. The coefficient of static friction between the block and the wall is <math alttext="mu sub s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>μ</mi><mi>s</mi></msub></math>. If the magnitude of <math alttext="F sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math> is larger than the minimum required magnitude to keep the block in place, which of the following equations correctly describes the force of static friction, <math alttext="F sub lowercase f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math>, exerted on the block?

choices.label: <math alttext="F sub lowercase f, equals mu sub s, times F sub N" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>μ</mi><mi>s</mi></msub><msub><mi>F</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="F sub lowercase f, equals mu sub s, times F sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>μ</mi><mi>s</mi></msub><msub><mi>F</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="F sub lowercase f, equals mu sub s, times m g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>μ</mi><mi>s</mi></msub><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="F sub lowercase f, equals m g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="F sub lowercase f, equals m g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
